net.marfgamer.jraknet.client

Class RakNetClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.marfgamer.jraknet.client.RakNetClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RakNetClientListener, UnumRakNetPeer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RakNetClientBundleExample

    public class RakNetClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements UnumRakNetPeer, RakNetClientListener
    Used to connect to servers using the RakNet protocol.
    Author:
    Whirvis "MarfGamer" Ardenaur

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RakNetClient(DiscoveryMode discoveryMode, int... discoveryPorts)
      Constructs a RakNetClient with the specified DiscoveryMode and server discovery port.
      RakNetClient(int... discoveryPorts)
      Constructs a RakNetClient with the specified server discovery port with the DiscoveryMode set to DiscoveryMode.ALL_CONNECTIONS or DiscoveryMode.NONE if no discovery ports are specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(DiscoveryMode discoveryMode,
                    int... discoveryPorts)
        Constructs a RakNetClient with the specified DiscoveryMode and server discovery port.
        Parameters:
        discoveryMode - how the client will discover servers. If this is set to null, the client will enable set it to DiscoveryMode.ALL_CONNECTIONS as long as the port is greater than -1.
        discoveryPorts - the ports the client will attempt to discover servers on.

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(int... discoveryPorts)
        Constructs a RakNetClient with the specified server discovery port with the DiscoveryMode set to DiscoveryMode.ALL_CONNECTIONS or DiscoveryMode.NONE if no discovery ports are specified.
        Parameters:
        discoveryPorts - the ports the client will attempt to discover servers on.

      • addExternalServer

        public final void addExternalServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Adds a server to the client's external server discovery list. This functions like the normal discovery system but is not affected by the DiscoveryMode or discovery port set for the client.
        Parameters:
        address - the server address.

      • addExternalServer

        public final void addExternalServer(java.net.InetAddress address,
                                    int port)
        Adds a server to the client's external server discovery list. This functions like the normal discovery system but is not affected by the DiscoveryMode or discovery port set for the client.
        Parameters:
        address - the server address.
        port - the server port.

      • addExternalServer

        public final void addExternalServer(java.lang.String address,
                                    int port)
                             throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Adds a server to the client's external server discovery list. This functions like the normal discovery system but is not affected by the DiscoveryMode or discovery port set for the client.
        Parameters:
        address - the server address.
        port - the server port.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the specified address is an unknown host.

        address - the server address.

      • addMaximumTransferUnit

        public final void addMaximumTransferUnit(int maximumTransferUnit,
                                         int retries)
        Adds a MaximumTransferUnit that can be used by the client during connection.
        Parameters:
        maximumTransferUnit - the maximum transfer unit.
        retries - the amount of retries before the client moves on to the lower maximum transfer unit.

      • removeMaximumTransferUnit

        public final void removeMaximumTransferUnit(int maximumTransferUnit)

        maximumTransferUnit - the maximum transfer unit to remove.

      • handleMessage

        public final void handleMessage(RakNetPacket packet,
                                java.net.InetSocketAddress sender)
        Handles a packet received by the handler.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Sends a raw message to the specified address. Be careful when using this method, because if it is used incorrectly it could break server sessions entirely! If you are wanting to send a message to a session, you are probably looking for the sendMessage method.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to send.
        address - the address to send the buffer to.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(Packet packet,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Sends a raw message to the specified address. Be careful when using this method, because if it is used incorrectly it could break server sessions entirely! If you are wanting to send a message to a session, you are probably looking for the sendMessage method.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to send.
        address - the address to send the packet to.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(int packetId,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Sends a raw message to the specified address. Be careful when using this method, because if it is used incorrectly it could break server sessions entirely! If you are wanting to send a message to a session, you are probably looking for the sendMessage method.
        Parameters:
        packetId - the ID of the packet to send.
        address - the address to send the packet to.

      • updateDiscoveryData

        public final void updateDiscoveryData()
        Updates the discovery data in the client by sending pings and removing servers that have taken too long to respond to a ping.

      • updateDiscoveryData

        public final void updateDiscoveryData(java.net.InetSocketAddress sender,
                                      UnconnectedPong pong)
        This method handles the specified UnconnectedPong packet and updates the discovery data accordingly.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the UnconnectedPong packet.
        pong - the UnconnectedPong packet to handle.

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                   throws RakNetException
        Connects the client to a server with the specified address.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the server to connect to.
        Throws:
        RakNetException - if an error occurs during connection or login.

      • initConnection

        private final void initConnection()
                           throws RakNetException
        Starts the loop needed for the client to stay connected to the server.
        Throws:
        RakNetException - if any problems occur during connection.
